properties.title: Bank erosion undercutting trail edge
properties.description: Heavy rain washed away 3ft of trail shoulder along Bear Creek. Exposed roots and gravel visible. Trail still passable but narrowed to ~4ft.

properties.title: Graffiti on trail underpass wall
properties.description: Spray paint tags covering both walls of the Bear Creek Trail underpass at Sheridan Blvd. Multiple colors, approximately 15ft wide.

properties.title: Cracked pavement with standing water
properties.description: Large longitudinal crack in asphalt running ~20ft. Water pools here after rain creating ice hazard in winter. Crack is 1-2 inches wide.

properties.title: Ice sheet on north-facing trail section
properties.description: 50-yard stretch of solid ice on the Greenway near the Mineral Ave bridge. North-facing slope never gets direct sun. Multiple users reported slipping.
properties.fieldNotes: Applied ice melt on 2/7, need to recheck. Drainage issue causing refreeze.

properties.title: Potholes in Cornerstone Park parking lot
properties.description: Three large potholes near the west entrance of Cornerstone Park lot. Largest is about 18 inches wide and 4 inches deep. ADA accessible space drainage also affected.

properties.title: Illegal dumping near river access point
properties.description: Someone dumped a mattress, tire, and several garbage bags at the informal river access south of Carson Nature Center. Visible from trail.
properties.fieldNotes: Spotted during morning patrol. Will need truck access for removal.

properties.title: Overgrown branches blocking sight line
properties.description: Tree branches hanging low over the High Line Canal Trail near the Dahlia St crossing. Bikes can pass but tall riders have to duck. Sight line around curve is blocked.

properties.title: Trail washout at creek crossing
properties.description: Complete trail washout where Willow Creek crosses the trail. Gap is 6ft wide and 2ft deep. Trail is impassable. Water is still actively eroding the south bank.
properties.fieldNotes: Placed barricades on 2/7. Need engineering assessment for culvert repair.

properties.title: Trail marker post broken at base
properties.description: Wooden trail marker post snapped at ground level, likely from vehicle impact. Sign is lying in the grass. Mile marker 1.2.

properties.title: Broken bench seat slats
properties.description: Two wooden slats on the park bench near the playground at DeKoevend Park are cracked through. Bench is usable but unsafe -- splinter hazard.

properties.title: Flooding across trail at low point
properties.description: Standing water 6 inches deep across the Greenway at the low point south of Oxford Ave. Trail is underwater for ~30ft. Cyclists are riding on the grass to bypass.
properties.fieldNotes: Drain is clogged with sediment. Scheduled for vacuum truck.

properties.title: Marker graffiti on bridge railing
properties.description: Black permanent marker tags on the metal railing of the Big Dry Creek pedestrian bridge. About 3ft of railing affected.

properties.title: Icy walkway at garden entrance
properties.description: Black ice on the main entrance walkway at Hudson Gardens. Shaded by the building in morning, doesn't melt until afternoon.
properties.fieldNotes: Salt applied. Recurring issue -- needs better drainage or mat system.

properties.title: Root heave cracking trail surface
properties.description: Large cottonwood tree roots lifting the concrete trail surface in two places. Lips are 2-3 inches high, creating a trip/bike hazard.

properties.title: Riverbank erosion threatening trail foundation
properties.description: South Platte riverbank has eroded to within 5ft of the trail edge near Reynolds Landing. Large chunks of bank are calving into the river. Trail may collapse if not addressed.
properties.fieldNotes: Very concerning. Upstream development increasing runoff velocity. Engineering needs to assess.

properties.title: Large illegal dump site near river
properties.description: Extensive illegal dumping including construction debris, tires, and household waste in a clearing about 100ft off the main trail near the south end of South Platte Park.
properties.fieldNotes: Major cleanup needed. Truck access via service road from Santa Fe. Estimate 2 tons of debris.

properties.title: Fallen cottonwood blocking trail
properties.description: Large cottonwood tree fell across the High Line Canal Trail. Main trunk is ~18 inches diameter. Trail is completely blocked. Users are creating a social trail around it.

properties.title: Faded parking lot striping
properties.description: Parking lot lines at Goodson Recreation Center are barely visible, especially the handicap spaces. Rain and snow have worn the paint.

properties.title: Sediment deposit covering trail
properties.description: Mud and gravel washed onto the trail from an adjacent hillside after recent rains. About 30ft of trail covered in 2-4 inches of sediment.

properties.title: Spray paint on retaining wall
properties.description: Large spray paint tags covering approximately 40 sq ft of the concrete retaining wall along Cherry Creek Trail near the University Blvd crossing.

properties.title: Damaged fence exposing drop-off
properties.description: Chain link fence along the east side of Franklin Field is bent down, exposing a 6ft drop-off to the drainage channel below. Safety hazard for kids playing in the park.

properties.title: Snow drift blocking trailhead parking
properties.description: Plowed snow piled at the Columbine Trail parking lot entrance, blocking 4 of 12 spaces. Wind is drifting additional snow across the access road.

properties.title: Faded trail map kiosk
properties.description: The trail map at the Greenway kiosk near Bowles Ave has sun-faded to near illegibility. QR code is no longer scannable.

properties.title: Sinkhole forming on trail edge
properties.description: Ground is subsiding near a storm drain on the South Platte Trail. Hole is currently 2ft diameter and deepening. Cones placed but needs urgent repair before trail collapse.
properties.fieldNotes: Coned off 6ft radius. Subsurface pipe likely compromised. Engineering notified.

properties.title: Thistle patch encroaching on trail
properties.description: Dense thistle growth on both sides of the Lee Gulch trail narrowing the usable width to about 4ft. Thorny plants snagging clothing of passers-by.

properties.title: Frost heave buckling concrete panels
properties.description: Three consecutive concrete trail panels have buckled from frost heave. Lips are 3-4 inches high. Very hazardous for cyclists and wheelchair users.

properties.title: Graffiti on restroom exterior
properties.description: Spray paint tags on the north wall of the Buck Recreation Center restroom building. Three different tag styles, black and red paint.
properties.fieldNotes: Same tags as the ones on the underpass last month. Recurring vandal.

properties.title: Gully forming in trail drainage ditch
properties.description: Drainage ditch parallel to Bear Creek Trail is eroding into a gully. Headcutting is progressing toward the trail. Currently 3ft from trail edge.
properties.fieldNotes: Install check dams before spring rains. Will get worse fast.

properties.title: Drinking fountain not draining properly
properties.description: The drinking fountain near the Centennial Park playground runs continuously and isn't draining. Water is pooling around the base and creating a muddy area.

properties.title: Broken glass scattered on trail
properties.description: Shattered glass bottles covering approximately 10ft of the High Line Canal Trail. Appears to be from vandalism. Risk to cyclists and dogs.

properties.title: Stormwater outfall eroding riverbank
properties.description: Storm drain outfall is jetting water and eroding a deep channel into the riverbank. Sediment plume visible in the South Platte. Erosion extending toward trail.
properties.fieldNotes: Energy dissipater is gone. Need riprap and possibly a new apron. Contact engineering.

properties.title: Standing water in parking lot after rain
properties.description: Large puddle forming in the Littleton Golf Course parking lot east section. Water is 3-4 inches deep and covers 6 parking spaces. Drain grate appears clogged.

properties.title: Wrong direction on trail wayfinding sign
properties.description: The wayfinding sign at the Willow Creek / Columbine junction is pointing the wrong way for the Columbine Trail. Users are getting confused and going the wrong direction.

properties.title: Black ice on bridge deck
properties.description: Persistent black ice on the Cherry Creek Trail bridge deck over University Blvd. Bridge freezes before trail surface. Multiple near-falls reported by cyclists.

properties.title: Loose railing on observation deck
properties.description: The wooden railing on the Carson Nature Center observation deck overlooking the river is loose at two post connections. Wobbles significantly when leaned on.
properties.fieldNotes: Bolts need replacing -- wood has swelled and cracked around the originals. Parts ordered.

properties.title: Graffiti on interpretive sign
properties.description: Marker graffiti on the wildlife identification interpretive sign near Carson Nature Center. Black permanent marker over the bird silhouettes.
properties.fieldNotes: Cleaned with graffiti remover. Sign in good condition otherwise.

properties.title: Ponding water on trail surface
properties.description: Low spot in the Bear Creek Trail collecting water after rain. Creates a puddle about 8ft wide that doesn't drain for days.
properties.fieldNotes: Cut a drainage channel to divert water off the trail surface. Monitor for effectiveness.

properties.title: Dead elm tree leaning over trail
properties.description: Large dead elm tree with a significant lean toward the Columbine Trail. Bark is sloughing off and large branches have already fallen nearby. Risk of falling on trail users.
properties.fieldNotes: Needs arborist assessment. Possible Dutch elm disease. Mark for priority removal.

properties.title: Overflowing trash can at trailhead
properties.description: Trash can at the Mary Carter Greenway trailhead near Mineral Ave is overflowing. Trash blowing around the parking area. Likely needs more frequent pickup on weekends.

properties.title: Large pothole at parking lot entrance
properties.description: Deep pothole at the entrance to Writers Vista Park parking lot. About 2ft wide and 6 inches deep. Vehicles are swerving to avoid it, creating a collision hazard.

properties.title: Scour around bridge piling
properties.description: Water is scouring around the north bridge piling of the South Platte Trail pedestrian bridge. Exposed concrete footing visible. Potential structural concern if erosion continues.
properties.fieldNotes: Scour hole approximately 18 inches deep. Document with photos for engineering report.

properties.title: Missing bollard at vehicle gate
properties.description: One of three bollards at the Big Dry Creek Trail vehicle gate is missing. Gap is wide enough for a car to enter the trail. Need replacement bollard or temporary barrier.

properties.title: Canal bank slumping near trail
properties.description: The canal bank is slowly slumping toward the trail on the High Line Canal. Noticeable lean in the last 6 months. Trail isn't affected yet but may be in spring.
properties.fieldNotes: Monitor through spring. If slump accelerates, will need retaining structure.

properties.title: Graffiti on playground equipment
properties.description: Spray paint on the climbing structure at Lee Gulch Park. Green and white paint covering the slide and several support posts. Offensive language.

properties.title: Compacted snow making trail icy
properties.description: Foot traffic has compacted snow on the Little Dry Creek Trail into an ice sheet for about 100 yards through the shaded section. Very slippery.

properties.title: Asphalt edge crumbling
properties.description: The edge of the asphalt trail on Cherry Creek North is crumbling for about 50ft. Trail is narrowing as the edges break away. Sub-base visible.

properties.title: Cart path light out
properties.description: One of the solar pathway lights along the golf course cart path is not functioning. Post is intact but light does not turn on at dusk.

properties.title: Russian olive invasive growth
properties.description: Dense Russian olive growth encroaching on both sides of the Greenway near Reynolds Landing. Trail corridor narrowed to about 6ft. Thorny branches snagging jerseys.

properties.title: Dog waste bags accumulating near dispenser
properties.description: Full dog waste bags are being left on the ground next to the full waste station dispenser at Lorenz Park. Dispenser is out of bags and the trash can is overflowing.

properties.title: Headcut erosion advancing toward trail
properties.description: Active headcut erosion in the drainage adjacent to Lee Gulch Trail. Headcut has advanced 15ft toward the trail in the last month. Currently 8ft from trail edge.
properties.fieldNotes: Need grade control structure before spring runoff. This is accelerating.

properties.title: Unstable retaining wall above trail
properties.description: Stone retaining wall above the Bear Creek Trail has visible bulging and displaced stones. Risk of wall collapse onto trail below. Wall is about 6ft high.
properties.fieldNotes: Posted warning signs. Attempting to get structural engineer out this week.

properties.title: Sticker graffiti on trail sign
properties.description: Multiple stickers placed on the High Line Canal Trail directional sign at the Colorado Blvd crossing.
properties.fieldNotes: Removed with heat gun and adhesive remover.

properties.title: Loose grate on storm drain near trail
properties.description: Metal grate on the storm drain at the Columbine Trail / parking lot edge is loose and rocks when stepped on. Could trap a shoe or bike tire.

properties.title: Snow covering trail intersection markings
properties.description: Snow covering the painted trail intersection markings and arrows at the South Platte / Mary Carter junction. Users unsure which direction leads where.
properties.fieldNotes: Cleared snow and applied ice melt at the junction.

properties.title: Volunteer tree growing through fence
properties.description: A small tree is growing through the chain link fence along the Big Dry Creek Trail. The fence is being pushed out and the tree will eventually break it.

properties.title: Missing mile marker post
properties.description: Mile marker 3 on the Mary Carter Greenway is missing entirely. Post hole visible in ground. May have been removed by vandals or impact.

properties.title: Exposed electrical wiring at park light
properties.description: Park light pole at Ketring Park has exposed wiring at the base. Cover plate is missing and wires are visible and accessible. Electrocution hazard.
properties.fieldNotes: Circuit breaker tripped to de-energize. Electrician needed. Taped area off with caution tape.

properties.title: Settling creating uneven surface
properties.description: Trail surface settling unevenly where it crosses a buried utility line. Slight dip creating a bump for cyclists. Not hazardous yet but getting worse.

properties.title: Abandoned shopping cart in creek
properties.description: Shopping cart dumped in Willow Creek visible from the trail. Partially submerged and collecting debris, potentially blocking water flow.

properties.title: Picnic table leg broken
properties.description: One leg of the metal picnic table near the High Line Canal trail crossing is bent, making the table unstable. Table rocks when people sit on it.
properties.fieldNotes: Welded and reinforced the leg. Table is stable.

properties.title: Extensive graffiti on pedestrian tunnel
properties.description: Both walls and ceiling of the pedestrian tunnel under Bowles Ave are covered in graffiti. At least 4 different taggers. Some offensive content. High-visibility location.

properties.title: Social trail causing hillside erosion
properties.description: Unofficial social trail on the hillside at South Platte Park is creating an erosion gully. Users are cutting the switchback and the bare soil is washing downhill in rain.
properties.fieldNotes: Consider installing a barrier and restoration planting. Social trail is well-worn -- won't stop on its own.

properties.title: Drainage inlet clogged with debris
properties.description: Storm drain inlet at the Bear Creek Trail parking area is clogged with leaves and sediment. Water backing up across the parking lot during rain.

properties.title: Vandalized emergency call box sign
properties.description: The directional sign pointing to the emergency call box on the Little Dry Creek Trail has been bent 90 degrees. Now points in the wrong direction.

properties.title: Bridge deck boards rotting through
properties.description: Several wooden deck boards on the small pedestrian bridge over the side channel are soft and rotting. One board has a hole you can put your foot through.

properties.title: Speed bump needs repainting
properties.description: Yellow paint on the speed bump at the Family Sports Center parking lot entrance is almost completely worn off. Drivers don't see it and hit it at full speed.

properties.title: Snowplow damage to trail edge
properties.description: Snowplow scraped the asphalt edge of the Cherry Creek Trail when clearing the adjacent road. Gouged out about 6 inches of trail surface for 20ft.
properties.fieldNotes: Patched with cold asphalt. Notified road maintenance about plow alignment.

properties.title: Gravel washed off crusher-fine surface
properties.description: Rainstorm washed the crushed gravel surface off a 40ft section of the High Line Canal Trail, exposing the clay subbase. Muddy and slippery.

properties.title: Carved initials on park bench
properties.description: Someone carved initials and a date into the wooden park bench near the Milliken Park basketball court. Deep enough to be permanent.

properties.title: Water channeling down trail surface
properties.description: Rainwater is channeling down the Columbine Trail surface instead of draining off to the side. Cutting a groove in the center of the asphalt. Needs cross-drainage installed.
properties.fieldNotes: Trail grade is concentrating flow. Need water bars or cross-cut drains.

properties.title: Poor sight line at blind curve
properties.description: The sharp curve on the Greenway near Brent Lane has very poor sight lines. Vegetation on both sides blocks the view. Cyclists and pedestrians regularly surprise each other.

properties.title: Cracked concrete on walkway
properties.description: Large crack in the concrete walkway leading from the parking lot to the main entrance of Pirates Cove. Crack is widening and one side has dropped about an inch.

properties.title: Abandoned camp debris near trail
properties.description: Abandoned camping gear, blankets, and trash near the Big Dry Creek Trail under the Broadway bridge. Scattered across about 20ft of the creek bank.
properties.fieldNotes: Coordinated with social services before cleanup. Will schedule removal after outreach.

properties.title: Poison ivy growth near bench
properties.description: Poison ivy growing along the ground near the rest bench at the South Platte Trail overlook. Within 3ft of where people sit. Leaves clearly visible.

properties.title: Large section of trail undermined by water
properties.description: Creek has undermined a 15ft section of the Willow Creek Trail. The trail surface is intact but hollow underneath -- it will collapse with heavy traffic or machinery.
properties.fieldNotes: DO NOT drive equipment over this section. Barricade placed. Needs complete reconstruction.
